Technology

The Science Behind 8D Audio

Our extension uses the Web Audio API with HRTF (Head-Related Transfer Function) to simulate how your ears perceive sound from different directions.

Unlike simple panning, HRTF creates true 3D positioning ‚Äî the sound source orbits around your head with realistic height, depth, and distance cues.

Combined with custom reverb and dynamic compression, you get a consistent, immersive experience regardless of the source audio.

FAQ

Common Questions

Everything you need to know about 8D Audio.

Still have questions?

8D audio creates the illusion of sound moving around your head by dynamically positioning audio in 3D space. With headphones, it feels like music is rotating around you.

No! Any standard headphones or earbuds work. Over-ear headphones provide the best spatial perception, but it's not required.

Yes! It works with YouTube, Spotify Web, SoundCloud, Twitch, Netflix, and any website that plays audio. Chrome internal pages (chrome://) are the only exception.

No. The extension is optimized for minimal resource usage. Audio processing uses the efficient Web Audio API with negligible performance impact.

Absolutely not. All processing happens locally on your device. We don't collect, store, or transmit any audio data. Privacy first.

Due to browser security, DRM-protected content (like Netflix originals) cannot be processed. This is a browser limitation, not ours.
